translated: all buddhas have arrived at the end of benefiting themselves and others.

original: bdag la phan 'dogs pa ni chos gyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: bdag la phan 'dogs pa ni chos gyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The benefit for oneself is the suchness of phenomena.

original: gzhan la phan 'dogs pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: gzhan la phan 'dogs pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: The benefit for others is the wisdom of suchness.

original: bdag dang / gzhan la phan 'dogs par mdzad pa la mnga' brnyes nas @28a *//
analyzed: bdag dang / gzhan la phan 'dogs par mdzad pa la mnga' brnyes nas @28a *//
translated: Having attained mastery over the benefit for oneself and others,

original: mdzad pa mtha' yas pa rnam pa sna tshogs yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa'i phyir de lta bas na sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad bye brag tha dad pa rnam pa sna tshogs tshad med cing mtha' med pa snyed yod par rnam par phye ba yin no //
analyzed: mdzad pa mtha' yas pa rnam pa sna tshogs yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa'i phyir de lta bas na sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad bye brag tha dad pa rnam pa sna tshogs tshad med cing mtha' med pa snyed yod par rnam par phye ba yin no //
translated: the infinite varieties of deeds are brought to perfection. Therefore, all the qualities of the Buddha are distinguished as having infinite varieties and distinctions.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this.

original: dper na / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa la brten nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa sna tshogs dang / las kyi rgyu rnam pa sna tshogs dang / 'bras bu rnam par smin pa rnam pa sna tshogs bstan pa de bzhin du chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang /
analyzed: dper na / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa la brten nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa sna tshogs dang / las kyi rgyu rnam pa sna tshogs dang / 'bras bu rnam par smin pa rnam pa sna tshogs bstan pa de bzhin du chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang /
translated: Just as, based on false imagination, the various afflictions, the various causes of karma, and the various results of ripening are taught, in the same way, the suchness of phenomena

original: de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes la brten nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam pa sna tshogs dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam pa sna tshogs dang / nyan thos kyi chos rnam pa sna tshogs ston pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes la brten nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam pa sna tshogs dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam pa sna tshogs dang / nyan thos kyi chos rnam pa sna tshogs ston pa mdzad do //
translated: In the same way, on the basis of the wisdom of thatness, he reveals the various aspects of the qualities of the Buddhas, the various aspects of the qualities of the Solitary Sages, and the various aspects of the qualities of the Disciples.

original: chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes la brten nas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la rang dbang thob nas phun sum tshogs par 'gyur bas 'di ni mchog tu bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes la brten nas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la rang dbang thob nas phun sum tshogs par 'gyur bas 'di ni mchog tu bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: On the basis of the thatness of phenomena and the wisdom of thatness, he attains mastery over all the qualities of the Buddhas and becomes perfect. This is called the supreme inconceivability.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / nam mkha' la ri mo bris te rgyan du byed pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha' la ri mo bris te rgyan du byed pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
translated: For example, it is inconceivable to draw a picture in the sky and make it into an ornament.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes la brten nas sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yang @28b bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes la brten nas sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yang @28b bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, it is inconceivable to perfect the qualities of the Buddhas on the basis of the thatness of phenomena and the wisdom of thatness.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: ji ltar na chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes gnyis las rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' par yang rang gi ngang  gis mdzad pa'i dngos po dag phun sum tshogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes gnyis las rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' par yang rang gi ngang  gis mdzad pa'i dngos po dag phun sum tshogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that from the two—the suchness of phenomena and the wisdom of suchness—the various things that are done spontaneously without conceptualization are perfected?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das par smon lam la mnga' brnyes pa'i phyir mdzad pa'i dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba de bzhin du chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes mdzad pa'i dngos po de dag yongs su grub pa la mnga' brnyes pa'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das par smon lam la mnga' brnyes pa'i phyir mdzad pa'i dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba de bzhin du chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes mdzad pa'i dngos po de dag yongs su grub pa la mnga' brnyes pa'ang de bzhin no //
translated: For example, just as the various things that are done are perfected because the Tathāgata has attained mastery over the power of aspiration to pass into parinirvāṇa, in the same way, the perfection of the things that are done in the accomplishment of the suchness of phenomena and the wisdom of suchness is also like that.

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sems med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug kyang sngon gyi smon lam la brten nas ting nge 'dzin las langs te bya ba mang po rnams la mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sems med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug kyang sngon gyi smon lam la brten nas ting nge 'dzin las langs te bya ba mang po rnams la mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, although they enter the samādhi of the mindless state, based on their previous aspirations, arise from samādhi and engage in many activities.

original: de bzhin du chos gnyis po dag la rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' bar yang rang gi ngang gis mdzad pa dag yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos gnyis po dag la rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' bar yang rang gi ngang gis mdzad pa dag yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, although they are free from conceptualization regarding these two dharmas, their spontaneous activities are completely perfected.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / nyi ma dang / zla ba la'ang rnam par rtog pa med /
analyzed: dper na / nyi ma dang / zla ba la'ang rnam par rtog pa med /
translated: The sun and moon have no conceptualization.

original: chu dang / me long la'ang rnam par rtog pa med /
analyzed: chu dang / me long la'ang rnam par rtog pa med /
translated: Water and mirrors also have no conceptualization.

original: 'od snang ba la'ang rnam par rtog pa med mod kyi /🔽'on kyang gsum 'dus pa las gzugs brnyan 'byung @29a *//
analyzed: 'od snang ba la'ang rnam par rtog pa med mod kyi / 'on kyang gsum 'dus pa las gzugs brnyan 'byung @29a *//
translated: The light also has no conceptualization.

original: bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Nevertheless, when the three come together, a reflection arises.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes la'ang rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes la'ang rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' mod kyi /
translated: Likewise, the suchness of phenomena and the wisdom of suchness are also free from conceptualization.

original: 'od kyang smon lam la mnga' brnyes pa'i phyir sems can skal ba dang ldan pa dag la longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku nyi zla'i gzugs brnyan 'dus pa las snang ba bzhin du ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: 'od kyang smon lam la mnga' brnyes pa'i phyir sems can skal ba dang ldan pa dag la longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku nyi zla'i gzugs brnyan 'dus pa las snang ba bzhin du ston par mdzad do //
translated: However, because the light [of the Buddha] has attained mastery over aspirations, it manifests to fortunate sentient beings like the appearances of the Enjoyment Body and Emanation Body, like the reflection of the sun and moon appearing from the gathering [of clouds].

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Moreover, son of noble family,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / tshad med dpag tu med pa'i chu dang / me long dag 'od snang ba la brten pa'i phyir nam mkha' la gzugs brnyan mtshan ma tha dad pa rnam pa sna tshogs ston par byed kyang nam mkha' ni mtshan ma med pa nyid do //
analyzed: dper na / tshad med dpag tu med pa'i chu dang / me long dag 'od snang ba la brten pa'i phyir nam mkha' la gzugs brnyan mtshan ma tha dad pa rnam pa sna tshogs ston par byed kyang nam mkha' ni mtshan ma med pa nyid do //
translated: For example, in the sky, due to the immeasurable and limitless water and mirrors, the reflection of forms manifests various different characteristics, yet the sky is itself without characteristics.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de bzhin du slob ma rnams 'dul ba gang yin pa de ni chos kyi sku'i gzugs brnyan yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du slob ma rnams 'dul ba gang yin pa de ni chos kyi sku'i gzugs brnyan yin te /
translated: in the same way, whatever is the training of disciples is the reflection of the Dharma Body.

original: smon lam gyi mthus sku rnam pa gnyis la mtshan ma rnam pa sna tshogs snang yang chos kyi sku la ni tha dad pa'i mtshan ma mi mnga'o //
analyzed: smon lam gyi mthus sku rnam pa gnyis la mtshan ma rnam pa sna tshogs snang yang chos kyi sku la ni tha dad pa'i mtshan ma mi mnga'o //
translated: By the power of his vows, the two kinds of bodies manifest various marks, but the Dharma body has no separate marks.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: sku gnyis po de dag la brten nas ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bstan to //
analyzed: sku gnyis po de dag la brten nas ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bstan to //
translated: In dependence on these two kinds of bodies, all buddhas demonstrate nirvāṇa with remainder.

original: chos kyi sku de la brten nas ni lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bstan to //
analyzed: chos kyi sku de la brten nas ni lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bstan to //
translated: In dependence on the Dharma body, they demonstrate nirvāṇa without remainder.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: chos gzhan thams cad ni mthar zad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos gzhan thams cad ni mthar zad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all other phenomena will eventually be exhausted.

original: sku gsum po 'di @29b dag la brten nas ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bstan to //
analyzed: sku gsum po 'di @29b dag la brten nas ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bstan to //
translated: In dependence on these three bodies, all buddhas demonstrate nonabiding nirvāṇa.

original: sku gnyis kyi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas te /
analyzed: sku gnyis kyi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas te /
translated: They do not abide in nirvāṇa because of the two kinds of bodies,

original: chos kyi sku las gud na'ang sangs rgyas gzhan med pas so //
analyzed: chos kyi sku las gud na'ang sangs rgyas gzhan med pas so //
translated: because there are no other buddhas apart from the Dharma body.

original: ci'i phyir sku gnyis mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sku gnyis mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas she na /
translated: Why do the two bodies not abide in nirvana?

original: sku gnyis po de dag ni btags pa tsam ste /
analyzed: sku gnyis po de dag ni btags pa tsam ste /
translated: Because those two bodies are mere designations,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pas skad cig mar skye zhing 'gag pa dang bcas pas nges par mi gnas pa'i phyir dang / yang dang / yang du 'byung zhing nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pas skad cig mar skye zhing 'gag pa dang bcas pas nges par mi gnas pa'i phyir dang / yang dang / yang du 'byung zhing nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and are not real. Since they are momentary, they arise and cease, and so do not abide for certain, and since they occur again and again, they are not certain.

original: chos kyi sku ni de lta ma yin pas de'i phyir sku gnyis po mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas so //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni de lta ma yin pas de'i phyir sku gnyis po mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas so //
translated: The Dharma body is not like that, and so the two bodies do not abide in nirvana.

original: chos kyi sku ni gnyis su med pas de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas te /
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni gnyis su med pas de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas te /
translated: The Dharma body is nondual, and so it does not abide in nirvana.

original: de lta bas na sku gsum po de dag la brten nas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sku gsum po de dag la brten nas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in dependence on these three bodies, nonabiding nirvana is taught.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: so so'i skye bo thams cad ni mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir 'ching ba dang bcas shing sgrib pa dang bcas pas sku gsum po dag thag ring spong zhing sku gsum po dag dang nye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo thams cad ni mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir 'ching ba dang bcas shing sgrib pa dang bcas pas sku gsum po dag thag ring spong zhing sku gsum po dag dang nye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: All ordinary persons are bound and obscured because they possess the three realities. Therefore, they are far from the three bodies and do not approach the three bodies.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: kun tu btags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang las byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: kun tu btags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang las byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The imagined reality, the reality that is the dependent origination, and the reality that is the perfected.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid 'di dag yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir dang / zhi bar ma @30a *//
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid 'di dag yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir dang / zhi bar ma @30a *//
translated: Because they do not understand these realities, because they are not pacified,

original: gyur pa'i phyir  yongs su ma dag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gyur pa'i phyir  yongs su ma dag pa'i phyir te /
translated: and because they are not purified.

original: de lta bas na sku gsum po dag dang nye bar ma gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sku gsum po dag dang nye bar ma gyur pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are far from the three bodies.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid gsum po dag shes shing nye bar zhi ba dang / yongs su dag par gyur pa'i phyir de lta bas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sku gsum dang ldan par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid gsum po dag shes shing nye bar zhi ba dang / yongs su dag par gyur pa'i phyir de lta bas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sku gsum dang ldan par gyur pa yin no //
translated: Thus, because the three natures are known, pacified, and purified, the Bhagavān Buddha is endowed with the three bodies.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni sems rnam pa gsum po 'di dag ma spangs pa'i phyir sku gsum po dag thag ring du spangs nas nye bar mi 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni sems rnam pa gsum po 'di dag ma spangs pa'i phyir sku gsum po dag thag ring du spangs nas nye bar mi 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: because childish ordinary beings have not abandoned these three kinds of minds, they are far from the three bodies and do not approach them.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: bya ba slong ba'i sems dang / rtsa ba la brten pa'i sems dang / rtsa ba'i sems gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba slong ba'i sems dang / rtsa ba la brten pa'i sems dang / rtsa ba'i sems gang yin pa'o //
translated: The mind that instigates activity, the mind that is based on the root, and the fundamental mind.

original: thul bar byed pa'i lam rnams la brten nas ni bya ba slong ba'i sems zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thul bar byed pa'i lam rnams la brten nas ni bya ba slong ba'i sems zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: By relying on the path of taming, the mind that instigates activity is exhausted.

original: chos kyis slong ba'i lam la brten nas ni rtsa ba la rten pa'i sems zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyis slong ba'i lam la brten nas ni rtsa ba la rten pa'i sems zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: By relying on the path of Dharma, the mind that is based on the root is exhausted.

original: mchog tu 'gyur ba'i lam la brten nas ni rtsa ba'i sems zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchog tu 'gyur ba'i lam la brten nas ni rtsa ba'i sems zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: And by means of the path of the supreme vehicle, the fundamental consciousness is exhausted.

original: bya ba slong ba'i sems nye bar zhi bar gyur pa'i phyir ni sprul pa'i sku ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba slong ba'i sems nye bar zhi bar gyur pa'i phyir ni sprul pa'i sku ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The manifestation of the emanation body is due to the pacification of the mind that instigates action.

original: rtsa ba la brten pa'i sems nye bar zhi bar gyur pa'i phyir ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsa ba la brten pa'i sems nye bar zhi bar gyur pa'i phyir ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The manifestation of the beatific body is due to the pacification of the mind that is based on the root.

original: rtsa ba'i sems nye bar zhi bar gyur pa'i phyir ni chos kyi sku 'thob par 'gyur bas de'i phyir de bzhin @30b gshegs  pa thams cad sku gsum dang ldan par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sems nye bar zhi bar gyur pa'i phyir ni chos kyi sku 'thob par 'gyur bas de'i phyir de bzhin @30b gshegs  pa thams cad sku gsum dang ldan par gyur pa yin no //
translated: And the attainment of the reality body is due to the pacification of the fundamental consciousness. Therefore, all Tathāgatas come to possess the three bodies.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad ni sku dang po'i dbang gis sangs rgyas rnams dang mdzad pa mtshungs pa  dang / sku gnyis pa'i dbang gis sangs rgyas rnams dang dgongs pa mtshungs pa dang / sku gsum pa'i dbang gis sangs rgyas rnams dang sku mtshungs par gyur pa yin no; ;rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ni sku dang po'i dbang gis sangs rgyas rnams dang mdzad pa mtshungs pa  dang / sku gnyis pa'i dbang gis sangs rgyas rnams dang dgongs pa mtshungs pa dang / sku gsum pa'i dbang gis sangs rgyas rnams dang sku mtshungs par gyur pa yin no; ;rigs kyi bu /
translated: All the Buddhas are equal to the Buddhas by virtue of the first body; they are equal in intention by virtue of the second body; and they are equal in body by virtue of the third body.🔽Son of noble family!

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku dang po gang yin pa de ni sems can gyi mos pa'i rjes su rnam pa mang po dang ldan pa'i phyir mtshan nyid sna tshogs ston par mdzad pas de'i phyir mang por bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku dang po gang yin pa de ni sems can gyi mos pa'i rjes su rnam pa mang po dang ldan pa'i phyir mtshan nyid sna tshogs ston par mdzad pas de'i phyir mang por bstan pa yin no //
translated: The first body of the Buddhas is taught as manifold because it displays various characteristics in accordance with the many aspirations of sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku gnyis pa gang yin pa de ni slob ma rnams yid gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir mtshan nyid gcig kho na ston par mdzad pas de'i phyir gcig tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku gnyis pa gang yin pa de ni slob ma rnams yid gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir mtshan nyid gcig kho na ston par mdzad pas de'i phyir gcig tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: The second body of the Buddhas is taught as singular because it displays only a single characteristic for the disciples who are of one mind.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku gsum pa gang yin pa de ni mtshan ma gnyis kyis rnam pa thams cad kun tu khyab cing mtshan nyid du 'dzin pa'i spyod yul ma yin pas na de'i phyir gcig pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku gsum pa gang yin pa de ni mtshan ma gnyis kyis rnam pa thams cad kun tu khyab cing mtshan nyid du 'dzin pa'i spyod yul ma yin pas na de'i phyir gcig pa'ang ma yin /
translated: The third buddha body is not one because it pervades all aspects with two characteristics and is not an object of the domain of grasping characteristics.

original: tha dad pa'ang ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa'ang ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not different because it is not different from the two buddha bodies.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: dang po gang yin pa de ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la brten nas rab tu snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang po gang yin pa de ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la brten nas rab tu snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the first one appears based on the enjoyment body.

original: sku gnyis pa gang yin pa de ni chos kyi sku la brten nas snang bar 'gyur ro //🔽chos kyi sku gang yin pa de ni yang dag par yod pa ma yin pas rten @31a *//
analyzed: sku gnyis pa gang yin pa de ni chos kyi sku la brten nas snang bar 'gyur ro // chos kyi sku gang yin pa de ni yang dag par yod pa ma yin pas rten @31a *//
translated: The second body appears based on the dharma body.

original: pa'i gnas ci'ang mi mnga'o //
analyzed: pa'i gnas ci'ang mi mnga'o //
translated: Since the dharma body is not real, it has no basis at all.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di ltar chos gsum po de dag ni rtag pa'i don dang ldan pa'i phyir ni rtag pa zhes bstan la /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos gsum po de dag ni rtag pa'i don dang ldan pa'i phyir ni rtag pa zhes bstan la /
translated: in this way, those three dharmas are taught to be permanent because they have the meaning of permanence.

original: mi rtag pa'i don dang ldan pa'i phyir mi rtag pa zhes bstan te sprul pa'i sku gang yin pa de ni rtag par chos kyi 'khor lo bskor zhing de dang / de dag tu rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du thabs mkhas bston pa la rgyun chad med pa'i phyir de lta bas na rtag pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i don dang ldan pa'i phyir mi rtag pa zhes bstan te sprul pa'i sku gang yin pa de ni rtag par chos kyi 'khor lo bskor zhing de dang / de dag tu rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du thabs mkhas bston pa la rgyun chad med pa'i phyir de lta bas na rtag pa zhes bstan to //
translated: Because it possesses the meaning of impermanence, it is taught as “impermanent.” That which is the emanation body is permanent, since it is uninterrupted in turning the wheel of Dharma and in teaching skillful means according to circumstances in this and that place. Therefore, it is taught as “permanent.”

original: rtsa ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / phan sum tshogs pa'i mdzad pa chen po sngon du mi 'byung ba'i phyir de lta bas na mi rtag pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rtsa ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / phan sum tshogs pa'i mdzad pa chen po sngon du mi 'byung ba'i phyir de lta bas na mi rtag pa zhes bstan to //
translated: Because it is not the root, and because the great deeds of benefit do not occur beforehand, therefore it is taught as “impermanent.”

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku gang yin pa de ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas rgyun chad pa med par sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ma 'dres pa'i chos rnams yongs su sdud cing 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / sems can zad pa med pa bzhin du mdzad pa la yang zad pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir rtag pa zhes bstan to; ;rtsa ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku gang yin pa de ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas rgyun chad pa med par sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ma 'dres pa'i chos rnams yongs su sdud cing 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / sems can zad pa med pa bzhin du mdzad pa la yang zad pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir rtag pa zhes bstan to; ;rtsa ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: The enjoyment body is taught to be permanent because it has been uninterrupted since beginningless time, collecting and holding the unshared qualities of all buddhas, and because it has no end in its activity, just as there is no end to sentient beings.

original: phun sum tshogs pa'i mdzad pa chen po mngon du mi 'byung ba'i phyir mi rtag pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa'i mdzad pa chen po mngon du mi 'byung ba'i phyir mi rtag pa zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught to be impermanent because it is not the root and because the great, perfect activity does not manifest.

original: chos kyi sku gang yin pa de ni mngon par 'du byed pa'i chos kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: chos kyi sku gang yin pa de ni mngon par 'du byed pa'i chos kyang ma yin la /
translated: The dharmakāya is not a conditioned phenomenon.

original: tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid mi mnga' zhing rtsa ba yin par gyur pa'i phyir dang / nam mkha' dang mtshungs par gyur pa'i phyir rtag pa zhes @31b bstan to //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid mi mnga' zhing rtsa ba yin par gyur pa'i phyir dang / nam mkha' dang mtshungs par gyur pa'i phyir rtag pa zhes @31b bstan to //
translated: It is taught to be permanent because it is not a root, because it has no different characteristics, and because it is similar to space.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes las gud na mchog tu gyur pa'i ye shes med la; chos kyi de bzhin nyid las gud na'ang mchog tu gyur pa'i spyod yul med pas chos kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de dang / shes rab kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de'i de bzhin nyid rnam pa gnyis po gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes las gud na mchog tu gyur pa'i ye shes med la; chos kyi de bzhin nyid las gud na'ang mchog tu gyur pa'i spyod yul med pas chos kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de dang / shes rab kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de'i de bzhin nyid rnam pa gnyis po gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Apart from nonconceptual wisdom, there is no other wisdom that is superior, and apart from the suchness of phenomena, there is no other object that is superior. Therefore, the suchness of the dharmadhātu and the suchness of wisdom are not two suchnesses.

original: tha dad pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: They are not different.

original: de'i phyir chos kyi sku ni shes rab rnam par dag par gyur pa'i phyir dang / 'gog pa rnam par dag par gyur pa'i phyir gnyis rnam par dag par gyur ba yin pas des na chos kyi sku ni rnam par dag pa phun sum tshogs par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos kyi sku ni shes rab rnam par dag par gyur pa'i phyir dang / 'gog pa rnam par dag par gyur pa'i phyir gnyis rnam par dag par gyur ba yin pas des na chos kyi sku ni rnam par dag pa phun sum tshogs par gyur pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the dharmakāya is endowed with the perfection of purity because it is the purity of wisdom and the purity of cessation.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: sku gsum po dag tu rnam par dbye na tha dad pa rnam pa bzhir gyur te /
analyzed: sku gsum po dag tu rnam par dbye na tha dad pa rnam pa bzhir gyur te /
translated: if the three kāyas are analyzed, they are divided into four types.

original: sprul pa'i sku yin la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ma yin pa'ang yod /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku yin la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ma yin pa'ang yod /
translated: There are those who are emanation bodies but not enjoyment bodies.🔽There are those who are enjoyment bodies but not emanation bodies.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin la sprul pa'i sku ma yin pa'ang yod; sprul pa'i sku'ang yin la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin pa'ang yod /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin la sprul pa'i sku ma yin pa'ang yod; sprul pa'i sku'ang yin la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin pa'ang yod /
translated: There are those who are both emanation bodies and enjoyment bodies.

original: sprul pa'i sku'ang ma yin la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ma yin pa'ang yod do //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku'ang ma yin la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ma yin pa'ang yod do //
translated: There are those who are neither emanation bodies nor enjoyment bodies.

original: sprul pa'i sku yin la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku yin la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is an emanation body that is not an enjoyment body?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu smon lam la mnga' brnyes @32a *//
analyzed: 'di lta ste / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu smon lam la mnga' brnyes @32a *//
translated: It is as follows:🔽After the tathāgatas have passed into nirvāṇa, in order to benefit beings in accordance with conditions, they manifest through the power of their vows.

original: pa'i phyir rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du phan 'dogs pa gang yin pa de ni sprul pa'i sku zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i phyir rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du phan 'dogs pa gang yin pa de ni sprul pa'i sku zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called an emanation body.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin la sprul pa'i sku ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin la sprul pa'i sku ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is an enjoyment body that is not an emanation body?

original: sa'i mdun rol gyi sku gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sa'i mdun rol gyi sku gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the body that is prior to the stages.

original: sprul pa'i sku'ang yin la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'ang yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku'ang yin la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'ang yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Body of Transformation that is also the Body of Bliss?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gnas pa'i sku gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gnas pa'i sku gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the Body that abides in the Nirvana with a remainder.

original: sprul pa'i sku'ang ma yin la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'ang ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku'ang ma yin la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'ang ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Body that is neither the Body of Transformation nor the Body of Bliss?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: chos kyi sku gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the Dharma Body.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: chos kyi sku gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sku gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the Dharma Body is not divided into two.

original: gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba'ang gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba'ang gang zhe na /
translated: What is meant by non-duality?

original: chos kyi sku de la mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi gnas zhes bya ba gnyi ga med pas yod pa'ang ma yin med pa'ang ma yin /🔽gcig pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: chos kyi sku de la mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi gnas zhes bya ba gnyi ga med pas yod pa'ang ma yin med pa'ang ma yin / gcig pa'ang ma yin /
translated: In that Dharma Body, both characteristics and the basis of characteristics do not exist, so it is neither existent nor non-existent,

original: tha dad pa'ang ma yin /🔽grangs kyang ma yin /
analyzed: tha dad pa'ang ma yin / grangs kyang ma yin /
translated: neither one nor different,

original: grangs ma yin pa'ang ma yin /🔽snang ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: grangs ma yin pa'ang ma yin / snang ba'ang ma yin /
translated: neither a number nor not a number,

original: mun pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: mun pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: neither light nor dark.

original: de lta bu'i de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes des ni mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi gnas kyang ma gzigs /
analyzed: de lta bu'i de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes des ni mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi gnas kyang ma gzigs /
translated: Such gnosis of thatness does not see characteristics or the basis of characteristics.

original: yod pa'ang ma yin med pa'ang ma yin pa'ang mi gzigs /🔽gcig pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: yod pa'ang ma yin med pa'ang ma yin pa'ang mi gzigs / gcig pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It does not see existence or nonexistence.🔽It does not see sameness.

original: tha dad pa'ang ma yin pa'ang mi gzigs /🔽grangs kyang @32b ma yin /
analyzed: tha dad pa'ang ma yin pa'ang mi gzigs / grangs kyang @32b ma yin /
translated: It does not see difference.🔽It does not see number.

original: grangs ma yin pa'ang mi gzigs /
analyzed: grangs ma yin pa'ang mi gzigs /
translated: It does not see nonnumber.

original: snang ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: snang ba'ang ma yin /
translated: It does not see light.🔽It does not see darkness.

original: mun pa'ang ma yin pa'ang mi gzigs pas de'i phyir spyod yul rnam pa dag pa dang / shes rab rnam par dag pa la rnam par rtag tu'ang mi rung la /
analyzed: mun pa'ang ma yin pa'ang mi gzigs pas de'i phyir spyod yul rnam pa dag pa dang / shes rab rnam par dag pa la rnam par rtag tu'ang mi rung la /
translated: Therefore, it is not suitable to say that the pure domain and pure wisdom are the same or different.

original: bar zhes bya ba med kyang 'gog pa dang / lam gyi gzhi byed pa'i phyir chos kyi sku 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa rnam pa sna tshogs snang bar 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bar zhes bya ba med kyang 'gog pa dang / lam gyi gzhi byed pa'i phyir chos kyi sku 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa rnam pa sna tshogs snang bar 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Although there is no middle, it should be understood that the various deeds of the Tathāgata appear in this dharmakāya because it serves as the basis for cessation and the path.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: sku 'di'i rgyu dang / rkyen dang / spyod yul dang / gnas dang / 'bras bu dang / rtsa ba dpag par dka' ba'i phyir gang gis khong du chud par gyur na sku de ni theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: sku 'di'i rgyu dang / rkyen dang / spyod yul dang / gnas dang / 'bras bu dang / rtsa ba dpag par dka' ba'i phyir gang gis khong du chud par gyur na sku de ni theg pa chen po'o //
translated: Because the cause, condition, domain, abode, result, and root of this body are difficult to fathom, if one can comprehend it, that body is the Great Vehicle.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'o //
translated: It is the essence of the Tathāgata.

original: sku 'di nyid la brten nas dang po bskyed pa'i sems kyang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sku 'di nyid la brten nas dang po bskyed pa'i sems kyang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Relying on this very body, one will attain the mind that is first generated.

original: rnal 'byor sgom pa'i sems kyang rab tu snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor sgom pa'i sems kyang rab tu snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind of cultivating yoga will also be illuminated.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sems kyang rab tu snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sems kyang rab tu snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind of irreversibility will also be illuminated.

original: tshe gcig gis thogs pa'i sems dang / rdo rje'i sems dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sems kyang rab tu snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe gcig gis thogs pa'i sems dang / rdo rje'i sems dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sems kyang rab tu snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind obstructed by a single birth, the vajra mind, and the mind of the Tathāgata will also be illuminated.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi gya nom pa tshad med cing mtha' med pa thams cad kyang rab tu snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi gya nom pa tshad med cing mtha' med pa thams cad kyang rab tu snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All the immeasurable and limitless excellent dharmas of the Tathāgata will also be illuminated.

original: chos kyi sku 'di la brten nas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin chen po rnams kyang rab tu snang @33a *//🔽bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sku 'di la brten nas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin chen po rnams kyang rab tu snang @33a *// bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Based on this Dharma body, the inconceivable great samādhis also appear.

original: chos kyi sku 'di la brten nas ye shes chen po thams cad rab tu snang bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir sku gnyis po ting nge 'dzin dang; shes rab la brten nas mngon du snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sku 'di la brten nas ye shes chen po thams cad rab tu snang bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir sku gnyis po ting nge 'dzin dang; shes rab la brten nas mngon du snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Based on this Dharma body, all great wisdoms appear. Therefore, the two bodies appear based on samādhi and prajñā.

original: chos kyi sku 'di lta bu 'di ni rang gi ngo bo nyid la gnas pas brtag pa zhes kyang bstan to //
analyzed: chos kyi sku 'di lta bu 'di ni rang gi ngo bo nyid la gnas pas brtag pa zhes kyang bstan to //
translated: This kind of Dharma body is also called “abiding in its own essence.”

original: nga zhes kyang bstan to //🔽ting nge 'dzin chen po la gnas pa'i phyir skyid pa zhes kyang bstan to //
analyzed: nga zhes kyang bstan to // ting nge 'dzin chen po la gnas pa'i phyir skyid pa zhes kyang bstan to //
translated: It is also called “I.”🔽Because it abides in great samādhi, it is also called “bliss.”

original: ye shes chen po la gnas pa'i phyir yongs su gtsang ba zhes kyang bstan te /
analyzed: ye shes chen po la gnas pa'i phyir yongs su gtsang ba zhes kyang bstan te /
translated: Because it abides in great wisdom, it is also called “pure.”

original: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag par bzhugs pa dang / mnga' dbang brnyes pa dang / bde zhing skyid pa dang / yongs su gtsang bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag par bzhugs pa dang / mnga' dbang brnyes pa dang / bde zhing skyid pa dang / yongs su gtsang bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata is always present, he is powerful, he is happy and joyful, and he is completely pure.

original: ting nge 'dzin chen po la brten nas dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs ba ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / chos dran pa chen po la sogs ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa thams cad dang / byams pa chen po dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin chen po la brten nas dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs ba ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / chos dran pa chen po la sogs ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa thams cad dang / byams pa chen po dang /
translated: Relying on the great meditative absorption, he gathers all meditative absorptions, such as the meditative absorption of the heroic stride, all the applications of mindfulness, such as the great mindfulness of dharmas, the great love,

original: thugs rje chen po dang / gzungs thams cad dang / mngon par shes pa thams cad dang / dbang thams cad dang / chos mnyam pa thams cad yang dag par sdud cing de lta bu'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyang mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po dang / gzungs thams cad dang / mngon par shes pa thams cad dang / dbang thams cad dang / chos mnyam pa thams cad yang dag par sdud cing de lta bu'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyang mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the great compassion, all the dhāraṇīs, all the superknowledges, all the powers, and all the equalities of dharmas. And in this way, all the buddhadharmas come forth.

original: ye shes chen po 'di la brten nas stobs bcu @33b dang / bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / ma 'dres pa'i chos brgya brgyad cu dang / ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa thams cad kyang rab tu snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ye shes chen po 'di la brten nas stobs bcu @33b dang / bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / ma 'dres pa'i chos brgya brgyad cu dang / ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa thams cad kyang rab tu snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: On the basis of this great wisdom, the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, the four kinds of exact knowledge, the eighteen kinds of uncommon qualities of a buddha, and all the inconceivable, wondrous, and marvelous qualities will all become manifest.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che la brten nas rin po che tshad med cing mtha' med pa rnam pa sna tshogs snang bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin chen po'i rin po che dang / shes rab chen po'i rin po che la brten nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos gya nom pa tshad med cing mtha' med pa rnam pa sna tshogs mngon sum du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che la brten nas rin po che tshad med cing mtha' med pa rnam pa sna tshogs snang bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin chen po'i rin po che dang / shes rab chen po'i rin po che la brten nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos gya nom pa tshad med cing mtha' med pa rnam pa sna tshogs mngon sum du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as on the basis of a wish-fulfilling jewel, immeasurable and limitless kinds of jewels appear, in the same way, on the basis of the jewel of great samādhi and the jewel of great wisdom, immeasurable and limitless kinds of excellent buddhadharmas will manifest.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: de lta bu'i chos kyi sku'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gang yin pa de ni mtshan ma thams cad las yang dag par 'das shing mtshan ma la mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur bas rnam par brtag tu mi rung la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos kyi sku'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gang yin pa de ni mtshan ma thams cad las yang dag par 'das shing mtshan ma la mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur bas rnam par brtag tu mi rung la /
translated: The meditative absorption and wisdom of the dharmakāya are beyond all characteristics and cannot be conceptualized, since they do not cling to characteristics.

original: rtag pa'ang ma yin chad pa'ang ma yin pas dbu ma'i lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtag pa'ang ma yin chad pa'ang ma yin pas dbu ma'i lam zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they are neither eternal nor nihilistic, they are called the middle way.

original: rnam par rtog pa mnga' yang ngo bo nyid la rnam par rtog pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mnga' yang ngo bo nyid la rnam par rtog pa mi mnga'o //
translated: Although they possess conceptualization, they are not conceptualized in their very essence.

original: gsum du bgrang ba yod kyang ngo bo nyid la gsum du 'gyur ba med pas 'phel ba'ang med 'grib pa'ang med de /
analyzed: gsum du bgrang ba yod kyang ngo bo nyid la gsum du 'gyur ba med pas 'phel ba'ang med 'grib pa'ang med de /
translated: Although they are counted as three, they are not subject to increase or decrease, since their very essence is not subject to the three.

original: rmi lam dang / sgyu ma lta bur gzung ba'ang med 'dzin pa'ang med pas chos kyi sku de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par grol ba'i @34a *//
analyzed: rmi lam dang / sgyu ma lta bur gzung ba'ang med 'dzin pa'ang med pas chos kyi sku de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par grol ba'i @34a *//
translated: Since they are like a dream or an illusion, they are not apprehended and do not apprehend, and so the dharmakāya is the state of liberation, suchness.

original: gnas 'chi bdag gi rgyal po'i yul las yang dag par 'das pa skye shi'i mun pa las mngon par 'phags pa /
analyzed: gnas 'chi bdag gi rgyal po'i yul las yang dag par 'das pa skye shi'i mun pa las mngon par 'phags pa /
translated: It is the abode that is beyond the domain of the king of death, and it is exalted above the darkness of birth and death.

original: sems can thams cad kyis bsgrub par mi nus shing bgrod par mi nus pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis bsgrub par mi nus shing bgrod par mi nus pa /
translated: It is something that no sentient being can achieve or attain.🔽

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bzhugs pa'i gnas su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bzhugs pa'i gnas su gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the abode of the buddhas and bodhisattvas, which cannot be attained or reached by any sentient being.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / mi zhig gser 'dod pas de dang / de dag tu gser gyi rdo yongs su btsal ba las gser gyi rdo de rnyed nas zhib mor btags te snying po gang yin pa blangs nas so mal du bzhus btul nas gser yongs su dag pa rnyed par gyur na /
analyzed: dper na / mi zhig gser 'dod pas de dang / de dag tu gser gyi rdo yongs su btsal ba las gser gyi rdo de rnyed nas zhib mor btags te snying po gang yin pa blangs nas so mal du bzhus btul nas gser yongs su dag pa rnyed par gyur na /
translated: Suppose a person, desiring gold, were to search for gold-bearing rocks and find them. Having found them, he would crush them and take out the gold. He would then melt it down in a forge, refine it, and obtain pure gold.

original: yid bzhin du bsgyur te gdu bu la sogs pa rgyan gyi rnam pa sna tshogs su byas nas spyod pa mang po dang ldan par gyur kyang gser gyi rang bzhin la ni 'gyur ba ci'ang med do //🔽gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: yid bzhin du bsgyur te gdu bu la sogs pa rgyan gyi rnam pa sna tshogs su byas nas spyod pa mang po dang ldan par gyur kyang gser gyi rang bzhin la ni 'gyur ba ci'ang med do // gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: He could then transform it as he wished, making various kinds of ornaments such as bracelets and so forth, and use them in many ways, yet the nature of the gold would not change at all.

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis rnam par grol ba'i mchog yongs su gnyer ba'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis rnam par grol ba'i mchog yongs su gnyer ba'am /
translated: Moreover, a son or daughter of noble family who seeks the supreme liberation

original: 'jig rten pa'i dge ba mngon par bsgrubs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dge ba mngon par bsgrubs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: Having seen the Tathāgata or his retinue of disciples,

original: de'i slob ma'i 'khor mthong nas nye bar bsnyen te bcom ldan 'das la /🔽'di skad du /
analyzed: de'i slob ma'i 'khor mthong nas nye bar bsnyen te bcom ldan 'das la / 'di skad du /
translated: he approaches them and asks the Bhagavān,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: dge ba ni gang lags /
analyzed: dge ba ni gang lags /
translated: what is virtue?

original: mi dge ba ni gang lags /🔽yang dag pa'i rnal 'byor bsgoms pas rnam @34b par dag pa'i spyod pa thob par 'gyur ba ni gang lags zhes gsol pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / slob ma'i 'khor rnams de skad du zhu ba gsol ba gzigs par gyur na de'i tshe 'di snyam du rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: mi dge ba ni gang lags / yang dag pa'i rnal 'byor bsgoms pas rnam @34b par dag pa'i spyod pa thob par 'gyur ba ni gang lags zhes gsol pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / slob ma'i 'khor rnams de skad du zhu ba gsol ba gzigs par gyur na de'i tshe 'di snyam du rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: What is nonvirtue?🔽What is the practice of pure conduct that is attained through the cultivation of correct yoga?”🔽When the Tathāgata and the retinue of disciples see that he has made such a request, at that time they think, “This son of a good family or daughter of a good family desires to listen to the true Dharma in order to seek purity.”

original: rigs kyi bu mo 'di ni rnam par dag pa yongs su gnyer ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i chos yongs su nyan par 'dod pa yin no snyam du dgongs nas de la rnam par phye ste bstan pa nyid kyis go bar mdzad par 'gyur bas des thos nas kyang
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo 'di ni rnam par dag pa yongs su gnyer ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i chos yongs su nyan par 'dod pa yin no snyam du dgongs nas de la rnam par phye ste bstan pa nyid kyis go bar mdzad par 'gyur bas des thos nas kyang
translated: Having thought that, they explain it to him in detail, and he understands it.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pas mi brjed par bzung ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pas mi brjed par bzung ste /
translated: And with right mindfulness, they keep it in mind without forgetting it.🔽When they have attained the power of perseverance through the development of the mind of meditation on yoga, they completely eliminate the obscurations of laziness and purify all the obscurations. Having eliminated disrespect for the points of training, they pacify the mind of agitation and regret and enter the first stage.

original: rnal 'byor bsgoms pa'i sems bskyed pas brtson 'grus kyi stobs thob nas le lo'i sgrib pa yongs su bsal te sgrib pa thams cad yongs su sbyong bar byed pas bslab pa'i gnas rnams la ma gus pa spangs nas rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa'i sems nye bar zhi bar byas te sa dang po la 'jug par 'gyur bas sa dang po'i sems la brten nas sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i sgrib pa yongs su bsal nas sa gnyis par 'jug pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor bsgoms pa'i sems bskyed pas brtson 'grus kyi stobs thob nas le lo'i sgrib pa yongs su bsal te sgrib pa thams cad yongs su sbyong bar byed pas bslab pa'i gnas rnams la ma gus pa spangs nas rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa'i sems nye bar zhi bar byas te sa dang po la 'jug par 'gyur bas sa dang po'i sems la brten nas sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i sgrib pa yongs su bsal nas sa gnyis par 'jug pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, based on the mind of the first stage, they completely eliminate the obscurations to benefiting sentient beings and attain entry to the second stage.

original: sa der yang rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i sgrib pa yongs su bsal nas sa gsum par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa der yang rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i sgrib pa yongs su bsal nas sa gsum par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, having completely eliminated the obscurations to nonviolence, they enter the third stage.

original: sa der yang sems mnyen zhing rnam par byang ba'i sgrib pa yongs su bsal nas sa bzhi par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa der yang sems mnyen zhing rnam par byang ba'i sgrib pa yongs su bsal nas sa bzhi par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, having completely eliminated the obscurations to a supple and purified mind, they enter the fourth stage.

original: sa der yang thabs mkhas pa'i sgrib pa yongs @35a *//
analyzed: sa der yang thabs mkhas pa'i sgrib pa yongs @35a *//
translated: On this ground, the obscurations to skillful means are completely purified.🔽

original: su bsal nas sa lnga par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: su bsal nas sa lnga par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having completely eliminated the obscurations to skill in means on that ground, one enters the fifth ground.

original: sa der yang don dam pa dang / kun rdzob tu mthong ba'i sgrib pa yongs su bsal nas sa drug par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa der yang don dam pa dang / kun rdzob tu mthong ba'i sgrib pa yongs su bsal nas sa drug par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having completely eliminated the obscurations to seeing the ultimate and the conventional on that ground, one enters the sixth ground.

original: sa der yang mtshan ma la spyod par mthong ba'i sgrib pa yongs su bsal nas sa bdun par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa der yang mtshan ma la spyod par mthong ba'i sgrib pa yongs su bsal nas sa bdun par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having completely eliminated the obscurations to seeing the engagement with signs on that ground, one enters the seventh ground.

original: sa der yang mtshan ma nye bar zhi bar mi mthong ba'i sgrib pa yongs su bsal nas sa brgyad par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa der yang mtshan ma nye bar zhi bar mi mthong ba'i sgrib pa yongs su bsal nas sa brgyad par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having completely eliminated the obscurations to not seeing the pacification of signs on that ground, one enters the eighth ground.

original: sa der yang skye ba'i mtshan mar mi mthong ba'i sgrib pa yongs su bsal nas sa dgu par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa der yang skye ba'i mtshan mar mi mthong ba'i sgrib pa yongs su bsal nas sa dgu par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having completely eliminated the obscurations to not seeing the signs of birth on that ground, one enters the ninth ground.

original: sa der yang mngon par shes pa drug gi sgrib pa yongs su bsal nas sa bcu par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa der yang mngon par shes pa drug gi sgrib pa yongs su bsal nas sa bcu par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having completely eliminated the obscurations to the six superknowledges on that ground, one enters the tenth ground.

original: sa der yang shes bya'i sgrib pa dang / rtsa ba'i sems yongs su bsal nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa der yang shes bya'i sgrib pa dang / rtsa ba'i sems yongs su bsal nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: And in that stage, having completely eliminated the cognitive obscurations and the fundamental consciousness, one enters the stage of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa gsum yongs su dag par gyur ba'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa gsum yongs su dag par gyur ba'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The entry into the stage of the Tathāgata is called “extremely pure” because of the purification of the three aspects.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pa dang / sdug bsngal rnam par dag pa dang / mtshan ma rnam par dag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pa dang / sdug bsngal rnam par dag pa dang / mtshan ma rnam par dag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The purification of the afflictions, the purification of suffering, and the purification of signs.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽gser yang dag par bzhus sbyangs brdungs te dri ma med par bya ba'ang gser gyi rang bzhin gzod ma nyid nas rnam par dag pa @35b gsal bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir gser gyi ngo bo nyid yongs su dag pa'i dbang gis gser med par 'gyur ro zhes
analyzed: 'di lta ste / gser yang dag par bzhus sbyangs brdungs te dri ma med par bya ba'ang gser gyi rang bzhin gzod ma nyid nas rnam par dag pa @35b gsal bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir gser gyi ngo bo nyid yongs su dag pa'i dbang gis gser med par 'gyur ro zhes
translated: It is like this:

original: bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: Even though gold that has been melted, refined, and worked by an expert goldsmith is made spotless, it is not right to say that the nature of gold is nonexistent because of the purification of the essence of gold.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / chu rnyog  ma can yongs su dangs te dri ma med par bya ba'ang chu'i rang bzhin gzod ma nyid nas yongs su dag pa gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir chu med par 'gyur ro zhes byar mi rung ba de bzhin du chos kyi sku'ang nyon
analyzed: dper na / chu rnyog  ma can yongs su dangs te dri ma med par bya ba'ang chu'i rang bzhin gzod ma nyid nas yongs su dag pa gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir chu med par 'gyur ro zhes byar mi rung ba de bzhin du chos kyi sku'ang nyon
translated: For example, it is not possible to say that water does not exist when it is made clear and free of turbidity, because it clarifies the natural purity of water from the very beginning.

original: mongs pa dang 'dres par gyur pas sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba yongs su bsal nas bag chags lhag ma med par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin gzod ma nyid nas rnam par dag par gsal bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mongs pa dang 'dres par gyur pas sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba yongs su bsal nas bag chags lhag ma med par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin gzod ma nyid nas rnam par dag par gsal bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: Likewise, it is not possible to say that the dharmakāya does not exist when it is made free of the afflictions, because it clarifies the natural purity of the Buddha from the very beginning.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: dper na / nam mkha' la du ba dang / sprin dang / rdul dang / khug rna rnams kyis bsgribs pa dag gal te yongs su dang bar gyur na nam mkha'i khams yongs su dag par 'gyur bas nam mkha' med par 'gyur ro zhes byar mi rung ba de bzhin du chos kyi sku'ang sdug bsngal mang po thams cad yongs su zad pa'i
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha' la du ba dang / sprin dang / rdul dang / khug rna rnams kyis bsgribs pa dag gal te yongs su dang bar gyur na nam mkha'i khams yongs su dag par 'gyur bas nam mkha' med par 'gyur ro zhes byar mi rung ba de bzhin du chos kyi sku'ang sdug bsngal mang po thams cad yongs su zad pa'i
translated: For example, if the space element were to become completely pure, being freed from the obscurations of smoke, clouds, dust, and fog, it would not be tenable to say that space does not exist.

original: phyir rnam par dag pa zhes brjod kyang ngo bo nyid med par 'gyur ro zhes byar mi rung ngo //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: phyir rnam par dag pa zhes brjod kyang ngo bo nyid med par 'gyur ro zhes byar mi rung ngo // 'di lta ste /
translated: In the same way, although the dharmakāya is said to be pure because of the complete exhaustion of all suffering, it is not tenable to say that it does not exist.🔽For example,

original: dper na / skyes bu zhig gnyid log pa'i rmi lam na chu chen pos khyer ba las rkang lag bskyod de lus dang / @36a *//
analyzed: dper na / skyes bu zhig gnyid log pa'i rmi lam na chu chen pos khyer ba las rkang lag bskyod de lus dang / @36a *//
translated: a person in a dream is carried away by a great river. He moves his arms and legs and body,

original: sems le lo ma byas pa'i phyir chu bo thad kar bcad de pha rol gyi 'gram du phyin par mthong ba las rmi lam sad nas chu bo dang / chu rol dang / pha rol gyi 'gram tha dad par 'gyur ba mi mthong yang sems med do zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sems le lo ma byas pa'i phyir chu bo thad kar bcad de pha rol gyi 'gram du phyin par mthong ba las rmi lam sad nas chu bo dang / chu rol dang / pha rol gyi 'gram tha dad par 'gyur ba mi mthong yang sems med do zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: Because the mind is not lazy, it crosses the river directly and reaches the other shore. When one awakens from the dream, one does not see the river, the near shore, or the far shore as different, but it is not the case that there is no mind.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / 'khor ba'i yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su zad nas blo rnam par dag par gyur kyang med do zhes byar mi rung ba de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad mi skye
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dper na / 'khor ba'i yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su zad nas blo rnam par dag par gyur kyang med do zhes byar mi rung ba de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad mi skye
translated: For example,

original: ba'i phyir rnam par dag pa zhes brjod kyang sangs rgyas rnams kyang yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid med ces byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ba'i phyir rnam par dag pa zhes brjod kyang sangs rgyas rnams kyang yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid med ces byar mi rung ngo //
translated: even though the false conceptualization of saṃsāra is completely exhausted and the mind becomes pure, it is not the case that it does not exist. In the same way, although the dharmadhātu is said to be pure because all false conceptualization does not arise, it is not the case that the buddhas do not have a real essence.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Moreover, son of noble family,

original: chos kyi sku gang yin pa de nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag par gyur pas ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ston par mdzad do //🔽las kyi sgrib pa rnam par dag par gyur pas ni sprul pa'i sku ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: chos kyi sku gang yin pa de nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag par gyur pas ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ston par mdzad do // las kyi sgrib pa rnam par dag par gyur pas ni sprul pa'i sku ston par mdzad do //
translated: The Dharma Body, being purified of the afflictive obstructions, displays the Enjoyment Body.🔽Being purified of the obstructions to the knowable, it displays the Emanation Body.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag par gyur pa'i phyir ni chos kyi sku ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag par gyur pa'i phyir ni chos kyi sku ston par mdzad do //
translated: And being purified of the obstructions of karma, it displays the Dharma Body.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / nam mkha' la brten nas ni glog 'byung la /
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha' la brten nas ni glog 'byung la /
translated: just as lightning appears in the sky,

original: glog la brten nas ni 'od 'byung ba de bzhin du chos kyi sku la brten pa'i phyir ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: glog la brten nas ni 'od 'byung ba de bzhin du chos kyi sku la brten pa'i phyir ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ston par mdzad do //
translated: and light appears in the lightning, in the same way, the Enjoyment Body is displayed in dependence on the Dharma Body.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la brten nas ni @36b sprul pa'i sku ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la brten nas ni @36b sprul pa'i sku ston par mdzad do //
translated: The Emanation Body is displayed in dependence on the Enjoyment Body.

original: rang bzhin yongs su dag par gyur pa'i phyir ni chos kyi sku ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: rang bzhin yongs su dag par gyur pa'i phyir ni chos kyi sku ston par mdzad do //
translated: And the Dharma Body is displayed because of the purification of the nature.

original: shes rab rnam par dag par gyur pas ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: shes rab rnam par dag par gyur pas ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ston par mdzad do //
translated: By the purity of wisdom, he manifests the Enjoyment Body.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnam par dag par gyur pas ni sprul pa'i sku ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnam par dag par gyur pas ni sprul pa'i sku ston par mdzad do //
translated: By the purity of samādhi, he manifests the Emanation Body.

original: de gsum rnam par dag par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang tha mi dad do //
analyzed: de gsum rnam par dag par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni chos kyi de bzhin nyid dang tha mi dad do //
translated: That which is the purity of those three is not different from the suchness of phenomena.

original: de bzhin nyid dang ro gcig pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par grol ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / mthar thug pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pas de'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku la tha dad par gyur pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang ro gcig pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par grol ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / mthar thug pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pas de'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku la tha dad par gyur pa med do //
translated: Because of the suchness of being of one taste, the suchness of liberation, and the suchness of the ultimate, therefore there is no difference in the bodies of the Buddhas.

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: If a son of noble family

original: rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig /
translated: or a daughter of noble family

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: were to say:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag gi ston pa chen po yin no zhes de ltar nges par mngon par yid ches pa'i gang zag des ni shin tu dang ba'i bsam pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku tha dad pa mi mnga' bar khong du chud par gyur pas /🔽rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag gi ston pa chen po yin no zhes de ltar nges par mngon par yid ches pa'i gang zag des ni shin tu dang ba'i bsam pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku tha dad pa mi mnga' bar khong du chud par gyur pas / rigs kyi bu /
translated: The Tathāgata is my great teacher.”

original: don de'i phyir spyod yul rnams la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa rnams yongs su bsal bar gyur na chos de dag la mtshan nyid gnyis med par khong du chud cing rnam par rtog pa'ang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don de'i phyir spyod yul rnams la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa rnams yongs su bsal bar gyur na chos de dag la mtshan nyid gnyis med par khong du chud cing rnam par rtog pa'ang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Son of noble family, for this reason, when you clear away incorrect mental activity with regard to objects, you will understand that those phenomena are without two characteristics and will become free of conceptualization.

original: 'phags pa'i rnal 'byor sgom pa la de bzhin nyid de mtshan nyid gnyis su gyur pa med @37a *//
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rnal 'byor sgom pa la de bzhin nyid de mtshan nyid gnyis su gyur pa med @37a *//
translated: In the practice of noble yoga, suchness is without two characteristics.

original: cing yang dag par rnal 'byor sgom pa'i phyir 'di ltar de bzhin du sgrib pa thams cad yongs su bsal bas nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cing yang dag par rnal 'byor sgom pa'i phyir 'di ltar de bzhin du sgrib pa thams cad yongs su bsal bas nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since you are practicing true yoga, in this way all obscurations are cleared away and you will attain peace.

original: de bzhin nyid sgrib pa thams cad zhi bar gyur pas 'di ltar de bzhin du de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes mchog tu rnam par dag pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid sgrib pa thams cad zhi bar gyur pas 'di ltar de bzhin du de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes mchog tu rnam par dag pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, suchness is the pacification of all obscurations. Thus, suchness and the wisdom of suchness are attained as supreme purity.

original: de bzhin nyid dang; chos kyi dbyings dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes rnam par dag par gyur pas 'di ltar de bzhin du rang dbang du phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyang yongs su sdud par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang; chos kyi dbyings dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes rnam par dag par gyur pas 'di ltar de bzhin du rang dbang du phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyang yongs su sdud par 'gyur /
translated: Since suchness, the dharmadhātu, and perfect wisdom are purified, in the same way, all the perfections of independence are also gathered.

original: sgrib pa thams cad nye bar zhi bar yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad nye bar zhi bar yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: The pacification of all obscurations is also perfected.

original: sgrib pa thams cad rnam par dag pa thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad rnam par dag pa thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Because the attainment of the purification of all obscurations is called suchness, perfect wisdom, and the perfect characteristic.

original: de ltar mthong ba gang yin pa de ni 'phags pa'i lta ba zhes bya bas de ni yang dag pa nyid du sangs rgyas mthong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba gang yin pa de ni 'phags pa'i lta ba zhes bya bas de ni yang dag pa nyid du sangs rgyas mthong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is seen in this way is called the ārya view. Therefore, it is called seeing the Buddha in reality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos kyi de bzhin nyid mthong ba'i phyir de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ma lus par gzigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos kyi de bzhin nyid mthong ba'i phyir de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ma lus par gzigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they see the suchness of phenomena just as it is. Therefore, the Tathāgatas see all the Tathāgatas without exception.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas khams gsum las nges par byung nas @37b yang dag pa'i spyod yul yongs su tshol bas kyang khong du mi chud cing mthong bar mi nus pas so //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas khams gsum las nges par byung nas @37b yang dag pa'i spyod yul yongs su tshol bas kyang khong du mi chud cing mthong bar mi nus pas so //
translated: Because the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, having emerged from the three realms, do not understand and are unable to see even the correct domain of activity.

original: de lta bu'i 'phags pa'i gang zag gang gis kyang mi rig cing mi mthong bas so so'i skye bo thams cad the tshom dang / som nyi bskyed nas phyin ci log tu rnam par rtog par byed pas yongs su 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'phags pa'i gang zag gang gis kyang mi rig cing mi mthong bas so so'i skye bo thams cad the tshom dang / som nyi bskyed nas phyin ci log tu rnam par rtog par byed pas yongs su 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because no noble person whatsoever knows or sees such a thing, all ordinary beings, having given rise to doubt and uncertainty, conceive of it in a distorted way and do not transcend it.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / ri bong rgya mtsho la rkyal bar byed kyang gdon mi za bar pha rol tu phyin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / ri bong rgya mtsho la rkyal bar byed kyang gdon mi za bar pha rol tu phyin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, even if a rabbit were to swim across the ocean, it would certainly not reach the other side.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: nyam stobs shin tu chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyam stobs shin tu chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of its very weak strength.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyang de bzhin du chos kyi de bzhin nyid mngon par mi rtogs so //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyang de bzhin du chos kyi de bzhin nyid mngon par mi rtogs so //
translated: In the same way, immature, ordinary beings do not realize the suchness of phenomena.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rnam par rtog pa'i dgongs pa mi mnga' bar yang chos thams cad la mnga' chen po brnyes shing shes rab shin tu zab cing rnam par dag pa phun sum tshogs par gyur pa'i phyir dang / rang gi spyod yul du gyur cing gzhan dang yang thun mong du ma gyur pa'i phyir de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bskal pa tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa nas nyid kyi sku srog la phangs pa mi mnga' bar dka' ba spyad pas
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rnam par rtog pa'i dgongs pa mi mnga' bar yang chos thams cad la mnga' chen po brnyes shing shes rab shin tu zab cing rnam par dag pa phun sum tshogs par gyur pa'i phyir dang / rang gi spyod yul du gyur cing gzhan dang yang thun mong du ma gyur pa'i phyir de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bskal pa tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa nas nyid kyi sku srog la phangs pa mi mnga' bar dka' ba spyad pas
translated: The Tathāgatas, without any conceptual intention, have attained great mastery over all phenomena, and have perfected profound and pure wisdom. Because their domain is not shared with others, the Tathāgatas, from immeasurable, countless, and limitless eons ago, through austerities that are not dear to their own bodies and lives,

original: dpe zla med pa /
analyzed: dpe zla med pa /
translated: incomparable,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
translated: inconceivable,

original: tshig gi spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa /
analyzed: tshig gi spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa /
translated: beyond the scope of words,

original: rab tu dben pa /🔽'jigs pa rnams dang bral ba'i sku mchog dam pa @38a *//
analyzed: rab tu dben pa / 'jigs pa rnams dang bral ba'i sku mchog dam pa @38a *//
translated: utterly secluded,🔽and free from all fears.

original: 'di brnyes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di brnyes pa yin no //
translated: He has attained this supreme, holy body.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de ltar chos kyi de bzhin nyid rig cing mthong pa gang yin pa de ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba med pa /
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi de bzhin nyid rig cing mthong pa gang yin pa de ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba med pa /
translated: in this way, one who knows and sees the suchness of phenomena is free from birth, aging, and death.

original: che'i tshad kyang dpag tu med /
analyzed: che'i tshad kyang dpag tu med /
translated: His lifespan is immeasurable.

original: gnyid kyang med /
analyzed: gnyid kyang med /
translated: He has no sleep.

original: bkres pa dang / skom pa'ang med de /
analyzed: bkres pa dang / skom pa'ang med de /
translated: He has no hunger or thirst.

original: rtag par ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa /
analyzed: rtag par ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa /
translated: He always abides in samādhi.

original: sems rnam par g-yeng zhing g-yo ba'ang med do //
analyzed: sems rnam par g-yeng zhing g-yo ba'ang med do //
translated: His mind is free from distraction and agitation.

original: gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa la rtsod pa'i bsam pa bskyed pa des de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa la rtsod pa'i bsam pa bskyed pa des de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who give rise to the thought of debating with the Tathāgata will not see the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni gang ci gsung yang rung ste thams cad phan 'dogs par 'gyur bas gang gis mnyan cing thos pa de dag rnam par mi grol ba'ang med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni gang ci gsung yang rung ste thams cad phan 'dogs par 'gyur bas gang gis mnyan cing thos pa de dag rnam par mi grol ba'ang med do //
translated: Whatever the Thus-Gone Ones teach is beneficial, and those who listen and hear it will not fail to be liberated.

original: gcan gzan ma rungs pa dang / mi ma rungs pa dang / 'dre srin ma rungs pa dag dang yang phrad par mi 'gyur te chos thos pa'i dbang gis 'bras bu rnam par smin pa'ang zad par mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: legs so // sems can gang la la zhig las kyi sgrib pa'i dbang gis sdig pa rnam mngon par 'dus byas pa gang yin pa des nan tan brtson 'grus bskyed de nyin mtshan dus drug tu bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar te bus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas gus pas thal mo sbyar te sems rtsa gcig tu dran pa nye bar bsdus nas dag gi sgo nas bdag nyid kyis /

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /

analyzed: chos kyi rgyal mtshan chen po btsugs pa /

analyzed: thams cad sems can rnams la sman cing bde bar mdzad pa'i slad du rtag par chos kyi sbyin pa gtong ba /

original: skye dgu rmongs pa rnams drangs nas 'bras bu chen po thob pa la bkod de rtag tu bde ba mngon sum du mdzad par bzhed pa de lta bu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la skyabs su mchi ste mgo bos phyag 'tshal lo //

translated: He leads deluded beings and establishes them in the attainment of great fruition, always wishing to bring them manifest happiness. I go for refuge to such blessed buddhas, bowing my head in homage.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag yang dag pa'i shes rab dang / yang dag pa'i spyan dang / yang dag pa'i mkhyen pa dang / yang dag pa'i mnyam pas sems can gyi dge sdig gi las mkhyen cing gzigs pa thams cad la lus dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag yang dag pa'i shes rab dang / yang dag pa'i spyan dang / yang dag pa'i mkhyen pa dang / yang dag pa'i mnyam pas sems can gyi dge sdig gi las mkhyen cing gzigs pa thams cad la lus dang /
translated: I bow my head in homage to all the blessed buddhas who, with their perfect wisdom, their perfect vision, their perfect knowledge, and their perfect equanimity, know and see the virtuous and unvirtuous actions of sentient beings.

analyzed: ngag dang; yid kyis sems rtse gcig tu spyi bos btud de gus par phyag 'tshal lo //
