original: bdag gis thog ma ma mchis pa'i dus nas sdig pa'i rjes su 'brangs te sems can rnams dang lhan cig tu las kyi sgrib pa'i kha na ma tho ba bgyis pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis kun tu dkris shing bcings pas sangs rgyas ma 'tshal ba'i dus dang /
analyzed: bdag gis thog ma ma mchis pa'i dus nas sdig pa'i rjes su 'brangs te sems can rnams dang lhan cig tu las kyi sgrib pa'i kha na ma tho ba bgyis pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis kun tu dkris shing bcings pas sangs rgyas ma 'tshal ba'i dus dang /
translated: I have followed evil since beginningless time, and together with sentient beings I have committed the misdeeds of karmic obscurations.🔽Because of being bound and constricted by attachment, aversion, and delusion, I have not known the Buddha,🔽I have not known the Dharma, I have not known the Saṅgha, and I have not known virtue and nonvirtue.

original: @50a *// chos ma 'tshal ba'i dus dang / dge 'dun ma 'tshal ba'i dus dang / dge sdig ma 'tshal ba'i dbang gis lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi sgo nas mtshams ma mchis pa ngan sems kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la mtshal phyung ba dang /
analyzed: @50a *// chos ma 'tshal ba'i dus dang / dge 'dun ma 'tshal ba'i dus dang / dge sdig ma 'tshal ba'i dbang gis lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi sgo nas mtshams ma mchis pa ngan sems kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la mtshal phyung ba dang /
translated: Through the power of that, I have committed the heinous acts with my body, speech, and mind, I have had evil thoughts and have drawn blood from the body of a tathāgata,

original: yang dag pa'i chos la skur pa btab pa dang / dge 'dun mthun pa'i dbyen bgyis pa dang / dgra bcom pa bkum pa dang / pha ma bkum pa dang / lus kyi rnam pa gsum dang / ngag gi rnam pa bzhi dang / yid kyi spyod pa rnam pa gsum gyi dbang gis mi dge ba bcu'i las bdag nyid kyis bgyis pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i chos la skur pa btab pa dang / dge 'dun mthun pa'i dbyen bgyis pa dang / dgra bcom pa bkum pa dang / pha ma bkum pa dang / lus kyi rnam pa gsum dang / ngag gi rnam pa bzhi dang / yid kyi spyod pa rnam pa gsum gyi dbang gis mi dge ba bcu'i las bdag nyid kyis bgyis pa dang /
translated: I have myself committed the ten nonvirtuous actions,

original: gzhan bgyid du stsal ba dang / gzhan bgyid pa la rjes su yi rang ba dang / dge ba'i gang zag rnams la nan gyis skur pa btab pa dang / bre srang gis bslus pa dang / yang dag pa ma lags pa la yang dag par gzung ba dang /
analyzed: gzhan bgyid du stsal ba dang / gzhan bgyid pa la rjes su yi rang ba dang / dge ba'i gang zag rnams la nan gyis skur pa btab pa dang / bre srang gis bslus pa dang / yang dag pa ma lags pa la yang dag par gzung ba dang /
translated: I have forced others to commit them, I have rejoiced in others committing them, I have denigrated virtuous people, I have cheated with weights and measures, I have held what is incorrect to be correct,

original: mi gtsang ba'i bza' ba dang / btung ba gzhan dag la stsal ba dang / 'gro ba drug po de dag tu mchis pa'i pha ma ji snyed pa dag la phan tshun gnod pa bgyis pa dang / mchod rten gyi dkor brkus pa dang / phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi dkor dang /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i bza' ba dang / btung ba gzhan dag la stsal ba dang / 'gro ba drug po de dag tu mchis pa'i pha ma ji snyed pa dag la phan tshun gnod pa bgyis pa dang / mchod rten gyi dkor brkus pa dang / phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi dkor dang /
translated: and used the property of the Sangha of the four directions and the local Sangha as I wished.

original: mngon sum gyi dge 'dun gyi dkor rang dbang bgyis te yongs su spyad pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i chos dang / 'dul ba la bslab par ma mos pa dang / mkhan po dang / bla ma'i gdams ngag gi rjes su mi 'brang ba dang /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi dge 'dun gyi dkor rang dbang bgyis te yongs su spyad pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i chos dang / 'dul ba la bslab par ma mos pa dang / mkhan po dang / bla ma'i gdams ngag gi rjes su mi 'brang ba dang /
translated: I have not respected the Dharma and Vinaya taught by the Bhagavat, have not followed the instructions of my preceptor and teacher,🔽and have not respected the bodhisattvas.

original: nyan @50b thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / theg pa chen po'i spyod pa mngon par bsgrubs pa dag la smad par dga' bas rnal 'byor sgom pa'i gang zag rnams sems la 'gyod pa skyed pa dang / bdag pas khyad par du 'phags pa zhig mthong na phrag dog bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: nyan @50b thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / theg pa chen po'i spyod pa mngon par bsgrubs pa dag la smad par dga' bas rnal 'byor sgom pa'i gang zag rnams sems la 'gyod pa skyed pa dang / bdag pas khyad par du 'phags pa zhig mthong na phrag dog bskyed pa dang /
translated: They delight in disparaging the practice of the hearers, solitary buddhas, and the Great Vehicle. They cause those who practice yoga to feel regret. When they see someone who is superior to them, they feel jealous.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa dang / zang zing gi sbyin pa dag la rtag par ser sna dang / phangs pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / ma rig pas bsgribs shing log par lta bas sems rmongs bar gyur pa dang / dge ba'i sgyu ma bskyed pas sdig pas sdig pa 'phel bar gyur pa dang /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa dang / zang zing gi sbyin pa dag la rtag par ser sna dang / phangs pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / ma rig pas bsgribs shing log par lta bas sems rmongs bar gyur pa dang / dge ba'i sgyu ma bskyed pas sdig pas sdig pa 'phel bar gyur pa dang /
translated: They are always stingy and tight-fisted with the gift of Dharma and with material gifts. They are obscured by ignorance and confused by wrong views. They increase their evil by creating the illusion of virtue.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la smod pa'i bsam pa skyed pa dang / chos la chos ma lags par bshad pa dang / chos ma lags pa la chos su bshad pa la sogs pa 'di lta bu'i sdig pa mang po rnams bcom ldan 'das yang dag pa'i shes rab dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la smod pa'i bsam pa skyed pa dang / chos la chos ma lags par bshad pa dang / chos ma lags pa la chos su bshad pa la sogs pa 'di lta bu'i sdig pa mang po rnams bcom ldan 'das yang dag pa'i shes rab dang /
translated: I have disparaged the Tathāgatas, explained the Dharma as non-Dharma, explained non-Dharma as Dharma, and so forth.🔽I have committed many such sins. Now, in the presence of the Blessed Ones, who with their perfect wisdom,

original: yang dag pa'i spyan dang / yang dag pa'i mkhyen pa dang / yang dag pa'i mnyam pa'i mnyam pas thams cad mkhyen cing thams cad gzigs pa dag la deng bdag srog phyogs nas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi spyan sngar mthol shing bshags so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spyan dang / yang dag pa'i mkhyen pa dang / yang dag pa'i mnyam pa'i mnyam pas thams cad mkhyen cing thams cad gzigs pa dag la deng bdag srog phyogs nas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi spyan sngar mthol shing bshags so //

analyzed: thams cad mngon du phyung nas 'chab cing sbed par mi bgyid do //

analyzed: sngar ma bgyis pa'i kha na ma tho ba rnams slan chad mi bgyid do //

analyzed: sngar bgyis pa'i kha na ma tho ba rnams deng thams cad mthol zhing bshags so //
translated: I confess and reveal all the misdeeds that I have committed in the past.

original: ngan 'gro'i sems can dmyal ba dang / @51a *//
analyzed: ngan 'gro'i sems can dmyal ba dang / @51a *//
translated: I pray that all the karmic obscurations of beings in the lower realms, the hells,

analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / yi dvags kyi 'gro ba dang / lha ma yin gyi 'khor dang / mi khom pa brgyad po dag tu ltung bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi sgrib pa ci mchis pa dang / bdag gis tshe 'di la bgyis pa'i las kyi sgrib pa thams cad zhu byang nas sdig pa'i rnam par smin pa ci mchis pa ma 'ongs pa na mi myong ba smon to //
translated: the animal realm, the world of hungry ghosts, the retinue of demigods, and the eight unfavorable states, as well as all the karmic obscurations I have created in this life, may be purified and cleansed. I pray that I may not experience in the future any of the negative results of my misdeeds.

original: ji ltar 'das pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi spyod pa spyad pa na las kyi sgrib pa ci mchis pa thams cad mthol zhing bshags pa de bzhin du bdag gis las kyi sgrib pa ci mchis pa'ang mthol zhing bshags so //

translated: Just as the bodhisattvas of the past, when they were practicing the bodhisattva deeds, confessed all their karmic obscurations, in the same way I confess whatever karmic obscurations I have.

analyzed: thams cad mngon du phyung ste 'chab cing sbed par mi bgyid do //

analyzed: sngar bgyis pa'i sdig pa rnams zhu byang bar smon to //

translated: Just as the bodhisattva-mahasattvas of the future, when they are practicing the bodhisattva way, will confess all their karmic hindrances without exception, in the same way I now confess and repent my karmic hindrances.

original: thams cad mngon du phyung nas 'chab cing sbed par mi bgyid do //
analyzed: thams cad mngon du phyung nas 'chab cing sbed par mi bgyid do //
translated: I bring them all to light and do not conceal anything.

original: sngar bgyis pa'i sdig pa rnams zhu byang bar smon to //
analyzed: sngar bgyis pa'i sdig pa rnams zhu byang bar smon to //
translated: I pray that the evil I have done in the past may be purified.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i sdig pa rnams kyang bgyi ba'i thugs mi thub bo //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i sdig pa rnams kyang bgyi ba'i thugs mi thub bo //
translated: I am unable to do the evil I am planning for the future.

translated: Just as the bodhisattva-mahasattvas in the worlds of the ten directions, who are practicing the bodhisattva practices, confess and repent of whatever karmic hindrances they have, in the same way I now confess and repent of my karmic hindrances.

original: thams cad mngon du phyung nas 'chab cing sbed par mi bgyid do //
analyzed: thams cad mngon du phyung nas 'chab cing sbed par mi bgyid do //

original: sngar bgyis pa'i sdig pa rnams zhu byang bar smon to //
analyzed: sngar bgyis pa'i sdig pa rnams zhu byang bar smon to //
translated: I wish that the evil I have previously done may be completely extinguished.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i sdig pa rnams kyang bgyid pa'i thugs mi thub bo zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i sdig pa rnams kyang bgyid pa'i thugs mi thub bo zhes brjod par bya'o //

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: mtshan gcig nas dus ring po'i bar lta smos kyang ci dgos /

analyzed: gang la la zhig gis sdig pa byas nas rnam par dag pa yongs su tshol bar 'dod cing sems la ngo tsha ba dang bcas pas ma 'ongs pa na gdon mi za bar sdig pa'i rnam par smin pa yod do zhes mngon par yid ches nas 'jigs shing
translated: Whoever has committed evil and wishes to seek purification, with a sense of shame, should believe that in the future there will certainly be the ripening of evil karma, and should give rise to great fear and🔽terror.

analyzed: skrag pa chen po skyes pa des 'di ltar bshags par bya'o // 'di lta ste /

analyzed: gos bsregs par gyur na myur ba kho nar me gsod par byed de /

analyzed: gal te zhi bar ma gyur na sems kyis bde ba thob par mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gang gis sdig pa byas na'ang de bzhin du mthol zhing bshags nas @52a *//

translated: If anyone wishes to be born in a wealthy family, with much wealth and jewels, and if he wishes to generate the thought of enlightenment and practice the Great Vehicle, he should perform repentance and purify the obscurations of karma.

analyzed: cho rigs btsun pa'i bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa'i khyim dag tu skye bar 'dod na'ang 'gyod tshangs byas nas las kyi sgrib pa yongs su byang bar bya'o //
translated: If he wishes to be born in a family of high caste, a brahmin family, a kṣatriya family, or a cakravartin king’s family, with the seven jewels, he should perform repentance and purify the obscurations of karma.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of a good family!

original: gal te rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha dang / 'thab bral gyi lha dang / dga' ldan gyi lha dang / 'phrul dga'i lha dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lhar skye bar 'dod na'ang 'gyod tshangs byas nas las kyi sgrib pa yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //

original: bsod nams skyes dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / gya nom snang dang / shin tu mthong dang / 'og min gyi lhar skye bar 'dod na'ang 'gyod tshangs byas nas las kyi sgrib pa yongs su sbyang bar @52b bya'o; ;gal te rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang /

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu yongs su gnyer bar 'dod na'ang 'gyod tshangs byas nas las kyi sgrib pa yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //

translated: If you wish to pursue the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, or the fruit of arhatship, you should purify your karmic obscurations by confessing your regrets.

original: gal te rig pa gsum dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rang dbang thob pa'i byang chub yongs su gnyer ba dang / mthar thug pa'i sar phyin nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang / yongs su dag pa'i ye shes dang /

translated: Nevertheless, if you were to place the upper robe over one shoulder, kneel on your right knee, respectfully place your palms together, and with a one-pointed mind bring to mind the following and rejoice, you would generate immeasurable merit.🔽

translated: Through their compassion, they exhort and completely tame all sentient beings, and through their deeds of giving the gift of the Dharma, they establish all beings in the attainment of inexhaustible bliss.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis bsod nams bsags pa las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gang yin pa dang / sems can gang gis de 'dra ba'i bsod nams da dung phun sum tshogs par ma gyur pa dag thams cad phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dag la bdag rjes su yi rang ngo // de bzhin du 'das pa dang / ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi bsod nams ji snyed pa thams cad la'ang bsam pa thag pa nas rjes su yi rang ngo zhes brjod par bya'o; ;rigs kyi bu /
translated: I rejoice in the roots of virtue that arise from the merit accumulated by the bodhisattvas, śrāvakas, and pratyekabuddhas, and in all the merit that has not yet been perfected by any sentient being, so that it may be perfected.🔽In the same way, I rejoice in all the merit of the buddhas, bodhisattvas, śrāvakas, and pratyekabuddhas of the past and the future.

original: de ltar na rjes su yi rang ba gang yin pa des bsod nams kyi phung po tshad med pa snyed 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na rjes su yi rang ba gang yin pa des bsod nams kyi phung po tshad med pa snyed 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Son of noble family, in this way, through rejoicing, one will obtain immeasurable heaps of merit.”

original: gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa'i stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad nyon mongs pa spangs te dgra bcom pa mngon par sgrub par gyur la rigs kyi @55b bu'am /
analyzed: gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa'i stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad nyon mongs pa spangs te dgra bcom pa mngon par sgrub par gyur la rigs kyi @55b bu'am /
translated: Suppose that all the sentient beings in the great trichiliocosm, equal to the sands of the Ganges River, were to abandon the afflictions and actualize arhatship, and suppose that some son or daughter of noble family were to make offerings and render service to them with the finest of all requisites—robes, alms-food, bedding, and medicines—for as long as they lived.

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig nam 'tsho'i bar du rtag par gos dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / mal cha dang / gsos sman mchog dam pa rnams kyis mchod pa dang / rim gro byas pas 'thob pa'i bsod nams gang yin pa des 'di ltar snga ma lta bur rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams de dang bskrun na stong gi cha gcig tsam du'ang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig nam 'tsho'i bar du rtag par gos dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / mal cha dang / gsos sman mchog dam pa rnams kyis mchod pa dang / rim gro byas pas 'thob pa'i bsod nams gang yin pa des 'di ltar snga ma lta bur rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams de dang bskrun na stong gi cha gcig tsam du'ang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: The merit that would be gained by doing so would not equal even a thousandth part of the merit of rejoicing in the above manner.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mchod pa byas pa'i bsod nams gang yin pa de la ni grangs dang bcas shing tshad dang bcas pas bsod nams thams cad yongs su sdud par mi 'gyur la rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams gang yin pa de ni tshad med grangs med pas dus gsum gyi
analyzed: mchod pa byas pa'i bsod nams gang yin pa de la ni grangs dang bcas shing tshad dang bcas pas bsod nams thams cad yongs su sdud par mi 'gyur la rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams gang yin pa de ni tshad med grangs med pas dus gsum gyi
translated: The merit of making offerings is finite and limited, and so it cannot gather up all merit. But the merit of rejoicing is infinite and unlimited, and so it can gather up all the merit of the three times.

original: bsod nams thams cad yongs su sdud par byed pas de'i phyir gang la la zhig dge ba'i rtsa ba khyad par can 'phel bar 'dod pas 'di ltar rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //🔽bud med gang la la zhig bud med kyi lus yongs su bsgyur nas skyes pa'i lus yongs su 'grub par 'dod na'ang rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams mngon par bsgrub par byed na gdon mi za bar yid la bsams pa bzhin du tshe 'di nyid la skyes
analyzed: bsod nams thams cad yongs su sdud par byed pas de'i phyir gang la la zhig dge ba'i rtsa ba khyad par can 'phel bar 'dod pas 'di ltar rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams mngon par bsgrub par bya'o // bud med gang la la zhig bud med kyi lus yongs su bsgyur nas skyes pa'i lus yongs su 'grub par 'dod na'ang rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams mngon par bsgrub par byed na gdon mi za bar yid la bsams pa bzhin du tshe 'di nyid la skyes
translated: Therefore, anyone who wishes to increase their roots of virtue should accomplish the merit of rejoicing in this way.

original: pa'i lus mngon par bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i lus mngon par bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If any woman who wishes to transform her female body and accomplish a male body accomplishes the merit of rejoicing, she will definitely attain a male body in this very life, just as she imagined.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la brgya byin lha'i dbang pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la brgya byin lha'i dbang pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, addressed the Blessed One:

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: rjes su yi rang @56a *//

analyzed: gsol ba btab pa'i bsod nams gang lags pa bshad du gsol /

analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: son of noble family,

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su gnyer ba gang yin pa des nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / theg pa chen po'i lam bsgom par 'dod na gang zag des nyin mtshan dus drug tu snga ma lta bu'i spyod lam gyis sems rtse gcig tu dran pa nye bar gzhag nas /🔽'di skad du /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su gnyer ba gang yin pa des nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / theg pa chen po'i lam bsgom par 'dod na gang zag des nyin mtshan dus drug tu snga ma lta bu'i spyod lam gyis sems rtse gcig tu dran pa nye bar gzhag nas / 'di skad du /
translated: “Any son or daughter of noble family who seeks unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening should cultivate the paths of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and the Great Vehicle. That person, day and night, during the six periods, should, with the conduct as before, one-pointedly establish mindfulness and say this:

analyzed: deng bdag phyogs bcu na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub brnyes par gyur kyang /

analyzed: bla na med pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo da dung ma bskor ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i sku spangs nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bzhed pa gang lags pa de dag thams cad la bdag bsam pa thag pa nas spyi bos btud de phyag bgyis nas sems can thams cad yongs su bsgral zhing @56b bde bar bgyi ba dang
translated: I bow my head to all of you who have not yet turned the wheel of the unsurpassed Dharma and who wish to pass into parinirvāṇa, abandoning your fully ripened bodies.

original: / sngar gong du bstan pa ltar bas pa ma mchis pa'i bde ba thob par bgyi ba'i slad du chos kyi 'khor lo chen po yongs su bskor ba dang / chos kyi char chen po dbab pa dang / chos kyi sgron ma chen po sbar ba dang /

translated: I beseech you to turn the wheel of the great Dharma, to rain down the great Dharma rain, to light the great Dharma torch,

original: don gyi tshul gsal par mdzad pa dang / thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i chos kyi sbyin pa btang nas yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' zhing 'jig rten na yun ring du bzhugs par bskul zhing gsol ba 'tshal lo //

translated: to illuminate the way of the meaning, to give the unobstructed gift of Dharma, and not to pass into parinirvāṇa but to remain in the world for a long time.

original: deng bdag gis bskul zhing gsol ba btab pa'i bsod nams gang lags pa 'di dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bgyi'o //

original: ji ltar 'das pa dang / da ltar gyi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis bskul ba dang / gsol ba btab pa'i bsod nams de dag byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa de bzhin du bdag gis kyang bskul ba dang / gsol ba btab pa'i bsod nams gang lags pa de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bgyi'o zhes brjod par bya'o //

translated: Just as the bodhisattva mahāsattvas of the past and present have dedicated the merit of their exhortations and prayers to enlightenment, I too dedicate the merit of this exhortation and prayer to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gal te gang la la zhig gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang ste de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa byas pa bas gang la la zhig gis de bzhin gshegs pa la @57a *//
analyzed: gal te gang la la zhig gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang ste de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa byas pa bas gang la la zhig gis de bzhin gshegs pa la @57a *//
translated: If someone were to fill the great trichiliocosm with the seven kinds of precious substances and make offerings to the Tathāgata, and if someone else were to make offerings to the Tathāgata with a single flower,🔽

analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo chen po bskor bar gsol ba btab pas 'thob pa'i bsod nams gang yin pa de snga ma bas ches khyad par du 'phags te /
translated: If someone were to fill the great trichiliocosm with the seven kinds of precious substances and offer it to the Thus-Gone One, and if someone else were to request the Thus-Gone One to turn the wheel of the great Dharma, the merit obtained by the latter would be far superior to the former.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni zang zing gi sbyin pa yin pa 'di ni chos kyi sbyin pa yin pas so //
analyzed: de ni zang zing gi sbyin pa yin pa 'di ni chos kyi sbyin pa yin pas so //
translated: Because the former is a gift of material things, while this is a gift of the Dharma.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis bkang ste sbyin pa btang ba lta re zhig zhog gi /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis bkang ste sbyin pa btang ba lta re zhig zhog gi /

original: gal te la la zhig gis gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang ste sangs rgyas thams cad la mchod pa byas pa bas bskul zhing gsol ba btab pa'i bsod nams gang yin
analyzed: gal te la la zhig gis gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang ste sangs rgyas thams cad la mchod pa byas pa bas bskul zhing gsol ba btab pa'i bsod nams gang yin
translated: If someone were to fill with the seven precious substances as many worlds as there are sand particles in the Ganges river and offer them to all the buddhas,

original: pa de de bas kyang ches khyad par du 'phags so //
analyzed: pa de de bas kyang ches khyad par du 'phags so //
translated: the merit of that would be far surpassed by the merit of requesting and supplicating.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i phan yon rnam pa lnga dang ldan te /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i phan yon rnam pa lnga dang ldan te /
translated: The benefits of the gift of Dharma are fivefold.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: dang po chos kyi sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni bdag dang / gzhan la phan 'dogs par byed la zang zing gi sbyin pa ni de lta ma yin pas so //
analyzed: dang po chos kyi sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni bdag dang / gzhan la phan 'dogs par byed la zang zing gi sbyin pa ni de lta ma yin pas so //
translated: First, the gift of Dharma benefits both oneself and others, whereas material gifts do not.

original: gnyis pa chos kyi sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni sems can khams gsum nas 'byin par byed pa yin la zang zing gi sbyin pa'i bsod nams gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa'i khams las mi 'da' bas so //

translated: Second, the gift of Dharma is what causes sentient beings to leave the three realms, while the merit of the gift of material things does not go beyond the desire realm.

original: gsum pa chos kyi sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni chos kyi sku yongs su dag par byed pa yin la zang zing gi @57b sbyin pas ni gzugs 'ba' zhig 'phel bar byed pas so //
analyzed: gsum pa chos kyi sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni chos kyi sku yongs su dag par byed pa yin la zang zing gi @57b sbyin pas ni gzugs 'ba' zhig 'phel bar byed pas so //
translated: Third, the gift of Dharma is what purifies the dharmakāya, while the gift of material things only increases form.

original: bzhi pa chos kyi sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni mthar thug pa med pa yin la zang zing gi sbyin pa ni zad par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: bzhi pa chos kyi sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni mthar thug pa med pa yin la zang zing gi sbyin pa ni zad par 'gyur bas so //
translated: Fourth, the gift of Dharma is inexhaustible, while the gift of material things is exhausted.

original: lnga pa chos kyi sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa yongs su gcod par byed la zang zing gi sbyin pa de ni 'dod pa'i sred pa tsam thul bar 'gyur bas so //

translated: Fifth, the gift of Dharma is what cuts through ignorance, while the gift of material things only subdues craving for desire.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: son of noble family,

original: bskul ba dang / gsol ba btab pa'i bsod nams ni tshad med dpag tu med pas dpe byar sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bskul ba dang / gsol ba btab pa'i bsod nams ni tshad med dpag tu med pas dpe byar sla ba ma yin no //
translated: The merit of urging and requesting is immeasurable and incalculable, and it is not easy to give a simile.

original: nga sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la chos kyi 'khor lo chen po yongs su bskor bar bskul bas dge ba'i rtsa ba'i dbang gis de lta bas na deng brgya byin dang / tshangs pa'i rgyal po la sogs pas nga la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar gsol ba btab pa yin te /
analyzed: nga sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la chos kyi 'khor lo chen po yongs su bskor bar bskul bas dge ba'i rtsa ba'i dbang gis de lta bas na deng brgya byin dang / tshangs pa'i rgyal po la sogs pas nga la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar gsol ba btab pa yin te /
translated: When I was previously practicing bodhisattva conduct, I urged the Tathāgatas to turn the great wheel of the Dharma. By the power of that root of virtue, today Śakra, Brahmā, and the kings of the gods and so forth are requesting me to turn the wheel of the Dharma.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo yongs su bskor bar bskul ba ni sems can rnams yongs su sgrol zhing bde bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo yongs su bskor bar bskul ba ni sems can rnams yongs su sgrol zhing bde bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: urging the turning of the wheel of the Dharma is for the sake of liberating and bringing happiness to sentient beings.

original: nga sngon byang chub kyi spyod pa spyad pa na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'jig rten na yun ring du bzhugs shing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' bar gsol ba btab pas na dge ba'i rtsa ba de la brten nas ngas stobs bcu dang /
analyzed: nga sngon byang chub kyi spyod pa spyad pa na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'jig rten na yun ring du bzhugs shing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' bar gsol ba btab pas na dge ba'i rtsa ba de la brten nas ngas stobs bcu dang /
translated: When I was practicing bodhisattva conduct in the past, I prayed to the thus-gone ones to remain in the world for a long time and not to pass into parinirvāṇa. On the basis of that root of virtue, I attained the ten powers,

original: bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / thugs rje chen po dang / ma 'dres pa'i chos grangs @58a *//🔽med pa snyed brnyes par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / thugs rje chen po dang / ma 'dres pa'i chos grangs @58a *// med pa snyed brnyes par gyur pa yin te /
translated: the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of correct understanding, great love, great compassion, and countless unshared qualities.

original: nga lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur yang nga'i yang dag pa'i chos 'jig rten na yun ring bar gnas par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: nga lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur yang nga'i yang dag pa'i chos 'jig rten na yun ring bar gnas par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Even though I will pass into parinirvāṇa through the nirvāṇa that is free from the remaining aggregates, my true Dharma will remain in the world for a long time.

original: nga'i chos kyi sku gang yin pa de ni rnam par dag cing dpe zla med pas mtshan mchog dam pa sna tshogs dang / mkhyen pa tshad med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa tshad med pa dang ldan zhing sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs par mdzad pas bskal pa bye ba brgya stong snyed du brjod kyang mthar thug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nga'i chos kyi sku gang yin pa de ni rnam par dag cing dpe zla med pas mtshan mchog dam pa sna tshogs dang / mkhyen pa tshad med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa tshad med pa dang ldan zhing sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs par mdzad pas bskal pa bye ba brgya stong snyed du brjod kyang mthar thug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: My dharmakāya is pure and incomparable, endowed with various sublime marks, immeasurable and limitless knowledge, and immeasurable inconceivable qualities, and benefits all sentient beings. Even if I were to speak for a hundred thousand million eons, it would not be exhausted.

original: 'gag par 'gyur yang chad pa'i lta bar 'gyur ba ma yin pas sems can gyi tha dad pa'i lta ba rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par bshig nas sems can gyi yang dag pa'i lta ba rnam pa sna tshogs bskyed par mdzad do //

translated: The gathering in of all individuals who possess delusion and all individuals who possess wisdom is the meaning of perfection.

translated: The meaning of perfection is the teaching of the various kinds of excellent jewels of the Dharma.

translated: The meaning of perfection is that which, having attained full enlightenment, perfects the ten powers of a Buddha, the four forms of fearlessness, the eighteen distinctive qualities, and so forth.

analyzed: thams cad la phan 'dogs shing yongs su zlos pa gang yin pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i don to //

translated: Because, for the first time, one attains the supramundane mind that one has never attained before, and because one accomplishes the great practices just as one has aspired to,

original: rab tu dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir sa dang po ni rab tu dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir sa dang po ni rab tu dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: one gives rise to great joy. Therefore, the first ground is called The Joyful.

original: @76b dri ma shin tu phra mo dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi nyes pa thams cad yongs su dag par gyur pas de'i phyir sa gnyis pa ni dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //

translated: Because one is completely purified of all the subtle stains and faults of faulty discipline, the second ground is called The Stainless.

original: shes rab dang / ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa'i 'od zer snang bar bsgul bar mi nus shing thul bar mi 'gyur ba dang / thos pas 'dzin pa'i gzungs brtsam par 'gyur bas de'i phyir sa gsum pa ni 'od byed pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang / ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa'i 'od zer snang bar bsgul bar mi nus shing thul bar mi 'gyur ba dang / thos pas 'dzin pa'i gzungs brtsam par 'gyur bas de'i phyir sa gsum pa ni 'od byed pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: and the light of immeasurable wisdom and concentration cannot be overcome or subdued, and the dhāraṇī of retention through hearing is begun. Therefore, the third ground is called The Luminous.

original: shes rab kyi mes nyon mongs pa rnams bsregs nas 'od kyi snang ba 'phel bar byed pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs sgom par byed pas de'i phyir sa bzhi pa ni 'od 'phro ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi mes nyon mongs pa rnams bsregs nas 'od kyi snang ba 'phel bar byed pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs sgom par byed pas de'i phyir sa bzhi pa ni 'od 'phro ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: Having burned afflictions with the fire of wisdom, the light of appearance increases, and one cultivates the factors of enlightenment. Therefore, the fourth ground is called The Radiating.

original: thabs mkhas pas bsgoms pa'i ye shes mchog rang dbang du gyur pa shin tu 'thob par dka' ba'i phyir dang / mthong ba dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa gdul par dka' ba thul bar gyur pa'i phyir sa lnga pa ni shin tu rgyal bar dka' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas bsgoms pa'i ye shes mchog rang dbang du gyur pa shin tu 'thob par dka' ba'i phyir dang / mthong ba dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa gdul par dka' ba thul bar gyur pa'i phyir sa lnga pa ni shin tu rgyal bar dka' zhes bya'o //
translated: Through skillful means, the supreme wisdom of meditation becomes one's own power, and it is very difficult to attain. Because the afflictions to be abandoned by seeing and meditation are difficult to subdue, the fifth ground is called Hard to Conquer.

original: spyod pa'i chos rgyun chad med par gsal bar mngon sum du gyur pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pa thams cad mngon sum du gyur pas de'i phyir sa drug pa ni mngon sum du gyur pa zhes bya'o //🔽zag pa med pa la bar chad med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i ting nge 'dzin yun ring po nas bsgoms pa'i phyir dang / sa de rnam par dag cing thogs @77a *//
analyzed: spyod pa'i chos rgyun chad med par gsal bar mngon sum du gyur pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pa thams cad mngon sum du gyur pas de'i phyir sa drug pa ni mngon sum du gyur pa zhes bya'o // zag pa med pa la bar chad med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i ting nge 'dzin yun ring po nas bsgoms pa'i phyir dang / sa de rnam par dag cing thogs @77a *//
translated: The Dharma of practice is clearly manifest without interruption, and all attention to the absence of signs is manifest. Therefore, the sixth stage is called Manifest.

original: pa med par gyur pa'i phyir sa bdun pa ni ring du song ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa med par gyur pa'i phyir sa bdun pa ni ring du song ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of the long cultivation of the uninterrupted, signless attention to the uncontaminated, and the concentration of liberation, and because that stage is pure and unobstructed, the seventh stage is called Far-reaching.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pa bsgoms pas rang dbang du gyur nas /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pa bsgoms pas rang dbang du gyur nas /
translated: Having cultivated the attention to the absence of signs, one becomes independent.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis bsgul bar mi nus pas de'i phyir sa brgyad pa ni mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis bsgul bar mi nus pas de'i phyir sa brgyad pa ni mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because one cannot be shaken by the afflictions, the eighth stage is called Immovable.

original: tha dad par gyur pa'i chos rnam pa sna tshogs thams cad bstan pa la rang dbang thob nas nyes pa med cing 'brel pa med par shes rab 'phel bar byed pa dang / dbang du gyur cing thogs pa med par gyur pas de'i phyir sa dgu pa ni legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tha dad par gyur pa'i chos rnam pa sna tshogs thams cad bstan pa la rang dbang thob nas nyes pa med cing 'brel pa med par shes rab 'phel bar byed pa dang / dbang du gyur cing thogs pa med par gyur pas de'i phyir sa dgu pa ni legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya'o //
translated: And because he has become powerful and unimpeded, the ninth stage is called Good Intelligence.

original: chos kyi sku nam mkha' dang 'dra ba dang / shes rab sprin chen po lta bur gyur nas /
analyzed: chos kyi sku nam mkha' dang 'dra ba dang / shes rab sprin chen po lta bur gyur nas /
translated: The Dharma Body is like space, and his wisdom becomes like a great cloud.

original: thams cad kun tu khyab par g-yogs par byed pa'i phyir de lta bas na sa bcu pa ni chos kyi sprin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kun tu khyab par g-yogs par byed pa'i phyir de lta bas na sa bcu pa ni chos kyi sprin zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it completely covers and pervades everything, the tenth stage is called Cloud of Dharma.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: bdag dang / chos la mtshan ma yod par mngon par zhen pa'i ma rig pa dang / 'khor ba'i ngan 'gro la skrag cing 'jigs pa'i ma rig pa ste ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis ni sa dang po la sgrib par byed do //
analyzed: bdag dang / chos la mtshan ma yod par mngon par zhen pa'i ma rig pa dang / 'khor ba'i ngan 'gro la skrag cing 'jigs pa'i ma rig pa ste ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis ni sa dang po la sgrib par byed do //
translated: The two ignorances of clinging to the signs of self and dharmas and the ignorance of fear and terror of the bad destinies of saṃsāra obscure the first stage.

original: bslab pa'i gnas shin tu phra mo dag la shes bzhin med pas nyams par byas pa'i ma rig pa dang / las kyi 'du byed rnam pa sna tshogs slong bar byed pa'i ma rig pa ste ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis ni sa gnyis pa la sgrib par byed do //🔽ma thob pa thob par 'dod pa la sred cing mngon @77b par zhen pa'i ma rig pa dang / gzungs khyad par du 'phags pa dag la sgrib par byed pa'i ma rig pa ste ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis ni sa gsum pa la sgrib par byed do //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gnas shin tu phra mo dag la shes bzhin med pas nyams par byas pa'i ma rig pa dang / las kyi 'du byed rnam pa sna tshogs slong bar byed pa'i ma rig pa ste ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis ni sa gnyis pa la sgrib par byed do // ma thob pa thob par 'dod pa la sred cing mngon @77b par zhen pa'i ma rig pa dang / gzungs khyad par du 'phags pa dag la sgrib par byed pa'i ma rig pa ste ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis ni sa gsum pa la sgrib par byed do //
translated: The ignorance of not being aware of the very subtle points of training, and the ignorance of arousing various formative forces of karma, these two ignorances obscure the second ground.🔽The ignorance of craving and attachment to attaining what has not been attained, and the ignorance that obscures the attainment of the most exalted dhāraṇīs, these two ignorances obscure the third ground.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba la mngon par dga' ba'i ma rig pa dang / shin tu gya nom pa'i chos rnam par dag pa sred cing mos pa'i ma rig pa ste ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis ni sa bzhi pa la sgrib par byed do //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba la mngon par dga' ba'i ma rig pa dang / shin tu gya nom pa'i chos rnam par dag pa sred cing mos pa'i ma rig pa ste ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis ni sa bzhi pa la sgrib par byed do //
translated: The ignorance of delighting in savoring meditative absorption, and the ignorance of craving and aspiring for the most sublime pure phenomena, these two ignorances obscure the fourth ground.

original: 'khor ba la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i ma rig pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par gzhol ba'i ma rig pa ste ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis ni sa lnga pa la sgrib par byed do //🔽rnal 'byor mngon du rgyu ba'i ma rig pa dang / mtshan ma rigs pa mngon du snang ba'i ma rig pa ste ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis ni sa drug pa la sgrib par byed do; ;mtshan ma shin tu phra mo rnams la mngon sum du spyod pa'i ma rig pa dang /
analyzed: 'khor ba la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i ma rig pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par gzhol ba'i ma rig pa ste ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis ni sa lnga pa la sgrib par byed do // rnal 'byor mngon du rgyu ba'i ma rig pa dang / mtshan ma rigs pa mngon du snang ba'i ma rig pa ste ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis ni sa drug pa la sgrib par byed do; ;mtshan ma shin tu phra mo rnams la mngon sum du spyod pa'i ma rig pa dang /
translated: These two ignorances obscure the fifth ground.🔽The ignorance of the manifestation of yoga and the ignorance of the manifestation of the appearance of the reason of signs: these two ignorances obscure the sixth ground.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pa la mngon par dga' ba'i ma rig pa ste ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis ni sa bdun pa la sgrib par byed do //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pa la mngon par dga' ba'i ma rig pa ste ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis ni sa bdun pa la sgrib par byed do //
translated: The ignorance of direct engagement with subtle signs and the ignorance of delighting in the attention of signlessness: these two ignorances obscure the seventh ground.

original: mtshan ma med par sgom par mngon par rtsol ba'i ma rig pa dang / mtshan ma la dbang thob pa la mngon par zhen pa'i ma rig pa ste ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis ni sa brgyad pa la sgrib par byed do //
analyzed: mtshan ma med par sgom par mngon par rtsol ba'i ma rig pa dang / mtshan ma la dbang thob pa la mngon par zhen pa'i ma rig pa ste ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis ni sa brgyad pa la sgrib par byed do //
translated: These two ignorances obscure the eighth stage.

original: bstan par bya ba'i don tshad med pa dang / ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge tshad med pa gnyis po 'di dag la mi @78a *//
analyzed: bstan par bya ba'i don tshad med pa dang / ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge tshad med pa gnyis po 'di dag la mi @78a *//
translated: The ignorance of not being skilled in the two, the immeasurable meaning to be taught and the immeasurable names, words, and letters,

original: mkhas pa'i ma rig pa dang / tshig gi spobs pa yid bzhin du ma gyur pa'i ma rig pa ste ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis ni sa dgu pa la sgrib par byed do //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i ma rig pa dang / tshig gi spobs pa yid bzhin du ma gyur pa'i ma rig pa ste ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis ni sa dgu pa la sgrib par byed do //
translated: and the ignorance of not having the confidence of speech as one wishes—these two ignorances obscure the ninth stage.

original: rdzu 'phrul chen po ston pa la rang dbang ma thob pa'i ma rig pa dang / shin tu phra ba'i gsang ba'i las kyi dngos po khong du ma chud pa'i ma rig pa ste ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis ni sa bcu pa la sgrib par byed do //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul chen po ston pa la rang dbang ma thob pa'i ma rig pa dang / shin tu phra ba'i gsang ba'i las kyi dngos po khong du ma chud pa'i ma rig pa ste ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis ni sa bcu pa la sgrib par byed do //
translated: The ignorance of not having attained mastery in displaying great miracles, and the ignorance of not having penetrated the extremely subtle secret activities—these two ignorances obscure the tenth stage.
